byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and MANSI CHOKSI

abstract: Ancient Jain ritual of santhara, in which elderly take vow to fast to death, faces challenge following decision by high court judge in state of Rajasthan that practice is tantamount to suicide, which is illegal in India; decision is likely to go to Supreme Court, and will be rare occasion in which India considers whether state can interfere with religious practices.
lead_paragraph: Citing a right to religious practice, members of the Jain faith are protesting a ruling barring santhara, a fast to the death that a judge declared a form of suicide.

headline.main: Sect’s Death Ritual Clashes With Indian Law
headline.print_headline: An End-of-Life Fast Clashes With Indian Law

snippet: Citing a right to religious practice, members of the Jain faith are protesting a ruling barring santhara, a fast to the death that a judge declared a form of suicide.
